greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest nonnegative integer not yet in the sequence with no repeated digits and no digits in common with a(n-1), starting with a(0)=0.
comment: The author of this sequence is Rodolfo Kurchan, who mentioned this sequence in a Facebook Group "Series", cf. link.
The sequence is finite, with last term a(5274) = 78642. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 17 2016
link: M. F. Hasler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5274 (All terms)
program: (PARI) {u=[]; (t(k)=if(#Set(k=digits(k))==#k,k)); a=1; for(n=1, 99, print1(a","); u=setunion(u, [a]); t(u[1])||u[1]++; while(#u>1&&u[2]<=u[1]+1, u=u[^1]); for(k=u[1]+1, 9e9, setsearch(u, k)&&next; (d=t(k))&& !#setintersect(Set(digits(a)), Set(d))&&(a=k)&&next(2))); a} \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 17 2016
results.author: _Claudio Meller_, Sep 17 2016
